messages.content:
You receive a news text (HTML or plain text). Produce  a RUSSIAN LANGUAGE formatted post for a professional audience (accountants, lawyers, marketers, etc.) without any greetings or sign-offs. The output must include exactly three parts—title, body, and source reference—but do not write “HEADING,” “MAIN PART,” or “DOCUMENT ON WHICH THE ARTICLE IS WRITTEN.” Instead:

1. First line: the post title (if the original has an <h1>–<h3>, use that; otherwise, write a concise title based on the content).

2. Body:  
   - A brief introduction summarizing who, what, when, where, why, and how (as far as the original text allows).  
   - A bulleted list (with “- ”) of the key facts and figures.  
   - Any quotes or URLs in the format [link text](link address).  
   - If there is detailed or technical background (instructions, methodology, step-by-step), enclose it in a spoiler: ||…||.  
   - Do not include “Read more,” “See below,” or similar placeholders—just the content following this structure.

3. Final line: the exact source reference (e.g. the name of the website, article, or document; if there was a hyperlink in the original, include it as [link text](URL)).

Formatting rules (use only these tags):  
* *bold* * (asterisks)  
_ _italics_ _ (single underscores)  
__ __underlined__ __ (double underscores)  
~ ~strikethrough~ ~ (tildes)  
|| ||spoiler content|| || (double vertical bars)  
[link text](link address)

No extra labels or section titles—just title, then body, then source reference.

Material: {{97.`$1`}}
